trans-unit.source: Use Azure Event Hubs with Apache Spark in HDInsight to process streaming data | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Use Azure Event Hubs with Apache Spark in HDInsight to process streaming data | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Step-by-step instructions on how to send a data stream to Azure Event Hub and then receive those events in Spark using a Zeppelin notebook
trans-unit.target: Step-by-step instructions on how to send a data stream to Azure Event Hub and then receive those events in Spark using a Zeppelin notebook

trans-unit.source: Spark Streaming: Process events from Azure Event Hubs with Apache Spark on HDInsight
trans-unit.target: Spark Streaming: Process events from Azure Event Hubs with Apache Spark on HDInsight

trans-unit.source: Spark Streaming extends the core Spark API to build scalable, high-throughput, fault-tolerant stream processing applications.
trans-unit.target: Spark Streaming extends the core Spark API to build scalable, high-throughput, fault-tolerant stream processing applications.

trans-unit.source: Data can be ingested from many sources.
trans-unit.target: Data can be ingested from many sources.

trans-unit.source: In this article we use Event Hubs to ingest data.
trans-unit.target: In this article we use Event Hubs to ingest data.

trans-unit.source: Event Hubs is a highly scalable ingestion system that can intake millions of events per second.
trans-unit.target: Event Hubs is a highly scalable ingestion system that can intake millions of events per second.

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, you will learn how to create an Azure Event Hub, how to ingest messages into an Event Hub using a console application in C#, and to retrieve them in parallel using a Zeppelin notebook configured for Apache Spark in HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, you will learn how to create an Azure Event Hub, how to ingest messages into an Event Hub using a console application in C#, and to retrieve them in parallel using a Zeppelin notebook configured for Apache Spark in HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] To follow the instructions in this article, you will have to use both versions of the Azure portal.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] To follow the instructions in this article, you will have to use both versions of the Azure portal.

trans-unit.source: To create an Event Hub you will use the [Azure portal](https://manage.windowsazure.com).
trans-unit.target: To create an Event Hub you will use the [Azure portal](https://manage.windowsazure.com).

trans-unit.source: To work with the HDInsight Spark cluster, you will use the [Azure Preview Portal](https://ms.portal.azure.com/).
trans-unit.target: To work with the HDInsight Spark cluster, you will use the [Azure Preview Portal](https://ms.portal.azure.com/).

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites:
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites:

trans-unit.source: You must have the following:
trans-unit.target: You must have the following:

trans-unit.source: An Azure subscription.
trans-unit.target: An Azure subscription.

trans-unit.source: See [Get Azure free trial](http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/videos/get-azure-free-trial-for-testing-hadoop-in-hdinsight/).
trans-unit.target: See [Get Azure free trial](http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/videos/get-azure-free-trial-for-testing-hadoop-in-hdinsight/).

trans-unit.source: An Apache Spark cluster.
trans-unit.target: An Apache Spark cluster.

trans-unit.source: For instructions, see [Provision Apache Spark clusters in Azure HDInsight](hdinsight-apache-spark-provision-clusters.md).
trans-unit.target: For instructions, see [Provision Apache Spark clusters in Azure HDInsight](hdinsight-apache-spark-provision-clusters.md).

trans-unit.source: An [Azure Event Hub](service-bus-event-hubs-csharp-ephcs-getstarted.md).
trans-unit.target: An [Azure Event Hub](service-bus-event-hubs-csharp-ephcs-getstarted.md).

trans-unit.source: A workstation with Microsoft Visual Studio 2013.
trans-unit.target: A workstation with Microsoft Visual Studio 2013.

trans-unit.source: For instructions, see [Install Visual Studio](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/e2h7fzkw.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For instructions, see [Install Visual Studio](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/e2h7fzkw.aspx).

trans-unit.source: Create Azure Event Hub
trans-unit.target: Create Azure Event Hub

trans-unit.source: From the [Azure portal](https://manage.windowsazure.com), select **NEW** > **Service Bus** > **Event Hub** > **Custom Create**.
trans-unit.target: From the [Azure portal](https://manage.windowsazure.com), select **NEW** > **Service Bus** > **Event Hub** > **Custom Create**.

trans-unit.source: On the **Add a new Event Hub** screen, enter an **Event Hub Name**, select the **Region** to create the hub in, and create a new namespace or select an existing one.
trans-unit.target: On the **Add a new Event Hub** screen, enter an **Event Hub Name**, select the **Region** to create the hub in, and create a new namespace or select an existing one.

trans-unit.source: Click the **Arrow** to continue.
trans-unit.target: Click the **Arrow** to continue.

trans-unit.source: wizard page 1
trans-unit.target: wizard page 1

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] You should select the same **Location** as your Apache Spark cluster in HDInsight to reduce latency and costs.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] You should select the same **Location** as your Apache Spark cluster in HDInsight to reduce latency and costs.

trans-unit.source: On the **Configure Event Hub** screen, enter the **Partition count** and **Message Retention** values, and then click the check mark.
trans-unit.target: On the **Configure Event Hub** screen, enter the **Partition count** and **Message Retention** values, and then click the check mark.

trans-unit.source: For this example, use a partition count of 10 and a message retention of 1.
trans-unit.target: For this example, use a partition count of 10 and a message retention of 1.

trans-unit.source: Note the partition count because you will need this value later.
trans-unit.target: Note the partition count because you will need this value later.

trans-unit.source: wizard page 2
trans-unit.target: wizard page 2

trans-unit.source: Click the Event Hub that you created, click **Configure**, and then create two access policies for the event hub.
trans-unit.target: Click the Event Hub that you created, click **Configure**, and then create two access policies for the event hub.

trans-unit.source: Name
trans-unit.target: Name

trans-unit.source: Permissions
trans-unit.target: Permissions

trans-unit.source: mysendpolicy
trans-unit.target: mysendpolicy

trans-unit.source: Send
trans-unit.target: Send

trans-unit.source: myreceivepolicy
trans-unit.target: myreceivepolicy

trans-unit.source: Listen
trans-unit.target: Listen

trans-unit.source: After You create the permissions, select the **Save** icon at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: After You create the permissions, select the **Save** icon at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: This creates the shared access policies that will be used to send (**mysendpolicy**) and listen (**myreceivepolicy**) to this Event Hub.
trans-unit.target: This creates the shared access policies that will be used to send (**mysendpolicy**) and listen (**myreceivepolicy**) to this Event Hub.

trans-unit.source: policies
trans-unit.target: policies

trans-unit.source: On the same page, take a note of the policy keys generated for the two policies.
trans-unit.target: On the same page, take a note of the policy keys generated for the two policies.

trans-unit.source: Save these keys because they will be used later.
trans-unit.target: Save these keys because they will be used later.

trans-unit.source: policy keys
trans-unit.target: policy keys

trans-unit.source: On the **Dashboard** page, click **Connection Information** from the bottom to retrieve and save the connection strings for the Event Hub using the two policies.
trans-unit.target: On the **Dashboard** page, click **Connection Information** from the bottom to retrieve and save the connection strings for the Event Hub using the two policies.

trans-unit.source: policy keys
trans-unit.target: policy keys

trans-unit.source: Receive messages in Spark on HDInsight using Zeppelin
trans-unit.target: Receive messages in Spark on HDInsight using Zeppelin

trans-unit.source: In this section, you create a [Zeppelin](https://zeppelin.incubator.apache.org) notebook to receive messages from the Event Hub into the Spark cluster in HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: In this section, you create a [Zeppelin](https://zeppelin.incubator.apache.org) notebook to receive messages from the Event Hub into the Spark cluster in HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: From the [Azure Preview Portal](https://ms.portal.azure.com/), from the startboard, click the tile for your Spark cluster (if you pinned it to the startboard).
trans-unit.target: From the [Azure Preview Portal](https://ms.portal.azure.com/), from the startboard, click the tile for your Spark cluster (if you pinned it to the startboard).

trans-unit.source: You can also navigate to your cluster under **Browse All** > **HDInsight Clusters**.
trans-unit.target: You can also navigate to your cluster under **Browse All** > **HDInsight Clusters**.

trans-unit.source: Launch the Zeppelin notebook.
trans-unit.target: Launch the Zeppelin notebook.

trans-unit.source: From the Spark cluster blade, click **Quick Links**, and then from the **Cluster Dashboard** blade, click **Zeppelin Notebook**.
trans-unit.target: From the Spark cluster blade, click **Quick Links**, and then from the **Cluster Dashboard** blade, click **Zeppelin Notebook**.

trans-unit.source: When prompted, enter the admin credentials for the cluster.
trans-unit.target: When prompted, enter the admin credentials for the cluster.

trans-unit.source: Follow the instructions on the page that opens up to launch the notebook.
trans-unit.target: Follow the instructions on the page that opens up to launch the notebook.

trans-unit.source: Create a new notebook.
trans-unit.target: Create a new notebook.

trans-unit.source: From the header pane, click **Notebook**, and from the drop-down, click **Create New Note**.
trans-unit.target: From the header pane, click **Notebook**, and from the drop-down, click **Create New Note**.

trans-unit.source: Create a new Zeppelin notebook
trans-unit.target: Create a new Zeppelin notebook

trans-unit.source: On the same page, under the **Notebook** heading, you should see a new notebook with the name starting with **Note XXXXXXXXX**.
trans-unit.target: On the same page, under the **Notebook** heading, you should see a new notebook with the name starting with **Note XXXXXXXXX**.

trans-unit.source: Click the new notebook.
trans-unit.target: Click the new notebook.

trans-unit.source: On the web page for the new notebook, click the heading, and change the name of the notebook if you want to.
trans-unit.target: On the web page for the new notebook, click the heading, and change the name of the notebook if you want to.

trans-unit.source: Press ENTER to save the name change.
trans-unit.target: Press ENTER to save the name change.

trans-unit.source: Also, make sure the notebook header shows a **Connected** status in the top-right corner.
trans-unit.target: Also, make sure the notebook header shows a **Connected** status in the top-right corner.

trans-unit.source: Zeppelin notebook status
trans-unit.target: Zeppelin notebook status

trans-unit.source: In the empty paragraph that is created by default in the new notebook, paste the following snippet and replace the placeholders to use your event hub configuration.
trans-unit.target: In the empty paragraph that is created by default in the new notebook, paste the following snippet and replace the placeholders to use your event hub configuration.

trans-unit.source: In this snippet, you receive the stream from Event Hub and register the stream into a temporary table, called **mytemptable**.
trans-unit.target: In this snippet, you receive the stream from Event Hub and register the stream into a temporary table, called **mytemptable**.

trans-unit.source: In the next section, we will start the sender application.
trans-unit.target: In the next section, we will start the sender application.

trans-unit.source: You can then read the data directly from the table.
trans-unit.target: You can then read the data directly from the table.

trans-unit.source: Run the applications
trans-unit.target: Run the applications

trans-unit.source: From the Zeppelin notebook, run the paragraph with the snippet.
trans-unit.target: From the Zeppelin notebook, run the paragraph with the snippet.

trans-unit.source: Press **SHIFT + ENTER** or the **Play** button at the top-right corner.
trans-unit.target: Press **SHIFT + ENTER** or the **Play** button at the top-right corner.

trans-unit.source: The status on the right-corner of the paragraph should progress from READY, PENDING, RUNNING to FINISHED.
trans-unit.target: The status on the right-corner of the paragraph should progress from READY, PENDING, RUNNING to FINISHED.

trans-unit.source: The output will show up in the bottom of the same paragraph.
trans-unit.target: The output will show up in the bottom of the same paragraph.

trans-unit.source: The screenshot looks like the following:
trans-unit.target: The screenshot looks like the following:

trans-unit.source: Output of the snippet
trans-unit.target: Output of the snippet

trans-unit.source: Run the **Sender** project and press **Enter** in the console window to start sending messages to the Event Hub.
trans-unit.target: Run the **Sender** project and press **Enter** in the console window to start sending messages to the Event Hub.

trans-unit.source: From the Zeppelin notebook, in a new paragraph, enter the following snippet to read the messages received in Spark.
trans-unit.target: From the Zeppelin notebook, in a new paragraph, enter the following snippet to read the messages received in Spark.

trans-unit.source: The following screen capture shows the messages received in the **mytemptable**.
trans-unit.target: The following screen capture shows the messages received in the **mytemptable**.

trans-unit.source: Receive the messages in Zeppelin
trans-unit.target: Receive the messages in Zeppelin

trans-unit.source: Restart the Spark SQL interpreter to exit the application.
trans-unit.target: Restart the Spark SQL interpreter to exit the application.

trans-unit.source: Click the **Interpreter** tab at the top, and for the Spark interpreter, click **Restart**.
trans-unit.target: Click the **Interpreter** tab at the top, and for the Spark interpreter, click **Restart**.

trans-unit.source: Restart the Zeppelin intepreter
trans-unit.target: Restart the Zeppelin intepreter

trans-unit.source: Run the streaming application with high availability
trans-unit.target: Run the streaming application with high availability

trans-unit.source: Using Zeppelin to receive streaming data into Spark cluster on HDInsight is a good approach to prototype your application.
trans-unit.target: Using Zeppelin to receive streaming data into Spark cluster on HDInsight is a good approach to prototype your application.

trans-unit.source: However, to run your streaming application in a production setup with high-availability and resilience, you need to do the following:
trans-unit.target: However, to run your streaming application in a production setup with high-availability and resilience, you need to do the following:

trans-unit.source: Copy over the dependency jar to the storage account associated with the cluster.
trans-unit.target: Copy over the dependency jar to the storage account associated with the cluster.

trans-unit.source: Build a streaming application.
trans-unit.target: Build a streaming application.

trans-unit.source: RDP into the cluster and copy over the application jar to the headnode of the cluster.
trans-unit.target: RDP into the cluster and copy over the application jar to the headnode of the cluster.

trans-unit.source: RDP into the cluster and run the application on the cluster node.
trans-unit.target: RDP into the cluster and run the application on the cluster node.

trans-unit.source: Instructions on how to perform these steps and a sample streaming application can be downloaded from GitHub at [https://github.com/hdinsight/hdinsight-spark-examples](https://github.com/hdinsight/hdinsight-spark-examples).
trans-unit.target: Instructions on how to perform these steps and a sample streaming application can be downloaded from GitHub at [https://github.com/hdinsight/hdinsight-spark-examples](https://github.com/hdinsight/hdinsight-spark-examples).

trans-unit.target: See also

trans-unit.target: Quick Start: Provision Apache Spark on HDInsight and run interactive queries using Spark SQL

trans-unit.target: Use Spark in HDInsight for building machine learning applications

trans-unit.target: Perform interactive data analysis using Spark in HDInsight with BI tools

trans-unit.target: Manage resources for the Apache Spark cluster in Azure HDInsight
